bibl.title: Charles W. Nordstrom v. William H. Moyer. Mandate
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.ab:
The President of the United States of America,
To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington
div1.p: Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington before you, or some of you, in a cause between entitled in the matter of the application of Charles W. Nordstrom for a writ of habeas corpus, wherein the order of the said Circuit Court, entered in said cause on the 3d day of April, A.D. 1894, is in the following words, viz:

figure.p:
"In the Matter of the Application of CHARLES W. NORDSTROM for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Relief Thereon.
This cause coming on for hearing upon the petition of petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus, the court being advised upon the petition and upon hearing counsel for petitioner, denies and refuses to grant the said writ; to which ruling of the court petitioner excepts. Exception allowed.
Petitioner thereupon gives notice that he appeals from the said ruling of the court and from the whole and every part thereof and appeals his said petition and his said cause and the whole and each and every part thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the city of Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and particularly appeals from the said ruling of the said court denying and refusing to grant the said writ of habeas corpus.
Which said appeal is here and now allowed. Done in open court this 3rd day of April, A. D. 1897.
C.H.Hanford, Circuit Judge."

div1.p: as by the inspection of the transcript of the record of the said Circuit Court, which was brought into the Supreme Court of the United States by virtue of an appeal whereon William H. Moyer, Sheriff of King County, and The State of Washington were made appellees agreeably to the act of Congress, in such case made and provided, fully and at large appears.

And whereas, in the present term of October, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety=seven, the said cause came on to be heard before the said Supreme Court, on the said transcript of record, and was on motions to dismiss or affirm which were argued by counsel:

On consideration whereof, It is now here ordered, adjudged, and decreed by this Court that the order, of the said Circuit Court in this cause be, and the same is hereby, affirmed with costs; and that the said William H. Moyer, Sheriff; et al; recover against the said Charles W. Nordstrom Sixty-two dollars for their costs herein expended and have execution therefor.

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such execution and proceedings be had in said cause, as according to right and justice, and the laws of the United States, ought to be had, the said appeal notwithstanding.
Witness the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the United States, the 18th day of February in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety=nine.
div1.ab: COSTS OF Moyer, Sheriff; et al.
James H. McKenny Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States.
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES. OCTOBER TERM, 1897
Costs of William H. Moyer, Sheriff re; et al; in No. 359
div1.p: 1897, October Term Transfer, $1.00;; appearance, .25; filing precipe and receipt, .50; filing papers, $2.00; filing motion, .25; filing briefs, $5.00; argument. 20; submission, .20; judgment, $1.00; filing same, .25; recording, .40; mandate, $5.00; preparing record for printer, etc., $9.00; cost of printing record, $16.50; attorney's docket fee, $20.00; costs and copy, .40
div1.ab: Test: James H. McKenney Clerk Supreme Court U.S.
SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES. No. 359, October Term, 1897.
Wm H. Moyer, Sheriff; et al.
FILED IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
